nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils
Class Period

java.lang.Object
  nl.strohalm.cyclos.utils.Period
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
NamedPeriod
public class Period
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

A date period, which can be configured not to take into account the time part in calculations by setting the useTime flag in false. Note that the useTime in false doesn't mean that the begin and end dates have a zero time. The useTime only interfere in calculations.
Also not that useTime==false is the default behavior. So by default the begin and end dates are truncated. If you don't want this behavior and need to use the times, you must explicitly set useTime to true.
You may also set the inclusiveBegin (default true) and inclusiveEnd (default true) flags.

Author:
luis
See Also:

includes

public boolean includes(java.util.Calendar date)
Checks whether the given date is included in this period. When the useTime flag is true, the time of the parameter (date) and the time of the begin and end dates of the period are taken into account to compute the result. If the exact begin date/time is included depends on the inclusiveBegin flag; by default, this is true, so begin date/time is considered to be included in the period. If the exact end date/time is included depends on the inclusiveEnd flag; which behaves in the same way as the inclusiveBegin flag. Both are true by default.
When the useTime flag is false, the dates are truncated to compute the result, and the inclusiveBegin and inclusiveEnd flags are ignored.
